review.title: Tracking Extrema in Dynamic Environment using Multi-Swarm Cellular PSO with Local Search
review.abstract: Many real-world phenomena can be modelled as dynamic optimization problems. In such cases, the environment problem changes dynamically and therefore, conventional methods are not capable of dealing with such problems. In this paper, a novel multi-swarm cellular particle swarm optimization algorithm is proposed by clustering and local search. In the proposed algorithm, the search space is partitioned into cells, while the particles identify changes in the search space and form clusters to create sub-swarms. Then a local search is applied to improve the solutions in the each cell. Simulation results for static standard benchmarks and dynamic environments show superiority of the proposed method over other alternative approaches.

sections.heading: II. CELLULAR PSO
sections.text: The original PSO, introduced in the 1990s, was based on swarm behavior. In PSO, each solution is considered to be a particle representing a single bird in a flock. First, the particles are created and randomly positioned within the search space. Afterwards, each particle is iteratively updated according to the best observed value for personal and global fitness to achieve optimal fitness [12]. In the cellular PSO, the search space is divided and a cellular automaton (CA) is built into the divided space to maintain diversity and allow an appropriate search in space. Each cell in the CA searches and controls its corresponding region according to some predefined rules. Each particle is assigned to a cell based on its position in the search process, each cell and its neighbors executed separately using the PSO method, which provides sufficient diversity and the ability to follow several optimal solutions.

sections.heading: V. CONCLUSIONS
sections.text: This paper proposes an extension of the cellular PSO algorithm through clustering and local search in the cellular environment.The inspiration for this research was to perform a more accurate search without increasing the number of partitions, achieved by defining and using groups in each cell.The simulation results in both static and dynamic environments show an improvement over their original versions.REFERENCES [1] C. metadata.abstractText: Many real-world phenomena can be modelled as dynamic optimization problems. In such cases, the environment problem changes dynamically and therefore, conventional methods are not capable of dealing with such problems. In this paper, a novel multi-swarm cellular particle swarm optimization algorithm is proposed by clustering and local search. In the proposed algorithm, the search space is partitioned into cells, while the particles identify changes in the search space and form clusters to create sub-swarms. Then a local search is applied to improve the solutions in the each cell. Simulation results for static standard benchmarks and dynamic environments show superiority of the proposed method over other alternative approaches.
